ratings.comment: Even Though I failed this class, he was the one of the nicest guy I've ever met. His lecture is well-organized and easy to follow. However, sometimes what his problems and examples are beyond our knowledge.

I dont know why some people say that he is the best; dont trust that! Prof. Shinault doesnt use Canvas at all, but use the Grade Scope, so I could never know how I did in class. Also his sections gradingis miserable, no curve nor homework drop; as you can see from the grade distribution, his section always has the lowest GPA. DONT TAKE HIS!

The best math instructor I've had at Madison. That isn't really saying much, I've had pretty poor luck with math professors. But he was WAY better than the others. Very clear and calm lecturer, you may almost fall asleep with how soft spoken he is. Go to lecture, it's not necessary but his explanations are so useful and expand on textbook so well.

Shinault is unironically the best lecturer I've ever had. He seemed to know exactly where stumbling points were in the material he taught, and always pointed them out without any sort of condescension. He left fantastically detailed comments on homework, and never failed to explain the application of the (probability) tools he taught. 10/10

MATH431 You learn a lot, but it is difficult. It is not possible to learn everything by yourself, the textbook/internet alone are not sufficient, you must go to lecture, office hours recommended. First two months are easy but it ramps up. Average grade for exams is a mid-low B. Final is noticeably harder so nail the first two exams+hw. Good prof.

Greg is one of the best professors I have had. His lectures are paced well and he explains all concepts clearly. He truly wants his students to understand the topics and be ready for the next course. Towards the final, he also gave the opportunity to earn extra credit. Exams are fair and all questions are based on the homework and review.

Greg is a great teacher. Unlike most upper-level math courses, his class focuses more on application than proofs. Overall, he is one of the best math professors I've had, and is funny too! The exams weren't too hard, but be prepared to come to class as he doesn't have any slides online, and the exams test stuff he went over in class.

Greg is one of the most entertaining professors I have had so far. His class is quite test heavy and homework is due weekly. He is a fair grader overall, and his exams reflect the homework and practice problems. In my lecture, there was a low average on midterm 2, so he agreed to replace the final exam grade with midterm 2.

He doesn't teach directly from the textbook and does his own research on Cryptographic topics. Very approachable. Can sometime make mistakes in lecture but has a good overall understanding. The course wasn't the most rigorous but I felt like I learned a lot and he keeps the material interesting and bite sized. Flexible if you have problems.

Honestly prof shinualt is the GOAT. A true genius who blesses students with calculus. If math is boring for you, prof shinualt will keep you entertained to random anecdotes and side comments. Fair grader overall, exams are very similar to homework assignments. Super relaxed class but still informative and as interesting as math can be.

Greg pretty much just stands at the front and works through example problems. I suggest sitting near the front because he writes so small you won't be able to read it 5 rows back. He also doesn't believe in curves despite test averages being low.

Greg paces his lectures beautifully - you don't feel like a lot of material is being thrown at you because you have a chance to breathe and take it all in. He is also very clear about what he wants from the student and isn't the easiest, but definitely the best math professor in this university.

Greg has cool shoes, but does not run a cool class. Watch out, those tests are hard. The practice problems and homework sets are much easier than the problems on the exams. Greg believes that curves aren't cool so don't expect to get a C and end up with an A like in chemistry.
His Calc 2 has been the easiest Calc course I've taken.
Gregory Shinault is my personal hero. If we all strived to be a little more like Greg, the world would be a better place.

Great professor. What other reviews describe as him being disinterested is actually him taking time to phrase things the best possible way during lecture. Lectures are always clear. Homework assignments were kind of tough for me, but tests were incredibly straightforward and very similar to the practice tests he gave out. Definitely would recommend

I had Greg Shinault before for Math 340 and took him again for Math 431. He really is a great professor, he is laid back, and that can be upsetting to some, but he is a consummate professional. He knows the material inside and out. He will answer all your questions in full detail, in office hour. And he has a dry wit that keeps lectures fresh!

He is definitely not interested in teaching the class and seems as he wanted to be somewhere else while teaching the class. Assignments are always posted about 3 days before it is due (they are not that hard). The course is nice, but I do not recommend this professor.

I was not impressed with Gregory Shinault. He was not organized and did not present class material in a clear manner. The few times I went to office hours, I spent the entire time waiting for him to try to figure out the homework assignments. I would advise against taking this professor for Math 431.

He's really helpful and he's always available at his office hours. He seems to really like teaching and he is charismatic and fun to be around. If you ever take Linear Algebra, remember to study eigenstuff (eigenvectors, eigenspaces, eigenvalues). He's quite passionate about both his teaching and his love of math.

Shinault is a very good professor. His lectures can be unclear at times but that is only due to the nature of the subject material, he is always available for office hours and explains things with crystal clarity, and will give you advice about upcoming exams if you ask the right questions. He is also a cool guy if you get to know him a little.

Really good math professor. Explains things very well. Lectures are well organized and presented in an understanding way. He is always willing to help outside of class and the exams are written very fairly.

Awesome professor, my only problem with him is that he speaks REALLY softly (sit in the front!). The class is super easy, and his lectures clarify anything that I didn't understand. The exams and homework are also cheap easy points. He's also pretty funny sometimes.
